DataElement.preferredName: Neuro QOL v2.0 NQCOGped18 Pediatric Cognitive Function Hard to Concentrate in School Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated response about whether it is hard for them to concentrate in school, using a 5-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Neuro QOL Pediatric Mental Health Domain Neuro QoL Cognitive Function Subdomain Hard to Concentrate in School Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The collection of Neuro-QoL item scales that assess the status of the mental health of a pediatric individual._The collection of Neuro-QoL item scales that assess perceived difficulties in cognitive abilities related to both executive function and general concerns.:A question about how much an individual has or had difficulty concentrating in school._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: 5 point scale - 1=Very much, 2=Quite a bit, 3=Somewhat, 4=A little bit, 5= Not at all.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: It is hard for me to concentrate in school

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.
